titles.title: A bill to provide for the transfer of certain lands in the State of Arizona, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. Report No: 100-188.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Agriculture Department, OMB.
Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks. Hearings held.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources received executive comment from Agriculture Department. Unfavorable.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston without amendment. With written report No. 100-196.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 372.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 6/29/1987--Passed House amended. (Measure passed House, amended) Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to convey to a school district in Payson, Arizona, specified lands known as the Payson School Site in Gila County, Arizona, for use as a public school. Requires the conveyance to take place, upon request of the school district, within 30 years for fair market value and administrative costs, reduced by amounts already paid by the school district for use of such property. Permits the school district to continue to use and occupy the property for an annual fee before the conveyance is completed. Retains a right of reversion to the United States if the school district attempts to transfer title or use the property for other than a public school.
